Text: For a blessing, the Crystarium citizens have shown no sign of panic in the wake of the starshower─'twas only the initial shock that distressed them, I think.
Indeed, some have even worked out that it was an illusion without needing to be told. Would that they held the same suspicions about the “Warrior of Light” and his message...

It worries me, at times, how easily the people accept the momentous and the horrific─but perhaps anyone who has spent their life looking up to find a reminder that the world is on the brink of destruction would be the same.
And their resilience is a good thing. It gives me hope, when I look at Halric and the others...
Put your faith in the Exarch...and do try to visit, now and again. He is so fond of you all.
Will you not be returning to the Crystarium?
We were told that you and yours hailed from some hitherto unknown land, but another world altogether?
And if you are soon to return home, what will this mean for the Exarch? Does he mean to...
Never mind. It is silly to dwell on such matters.
I, of course, wish those who departed the guard well on their journeys. I could see the sincerity in their eyes when they spoke.
Less easy to accept, however, is that you will all someday leave us, and for no mere sojourn.
I am certain that the Exarch thinks of it as well. But try as I might, I cannot speak to him of this so easily as I interfere in matters of his physical health...

<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Shouldn't you be back in the First? I understand your concern, but Krile and Master Matoya will take good care of the Scions' bodies. Now off with you.
Thank you for today. Words can scarcely describe how moved we were by your words. And to see one of the Warriors of Light returned in the flesh...
Were it not for the return of night to Norvrandt, I'd be hard-pressed to believe such miracles could happen.
I've never been much of a believer in miracles. At least not the nice kind─the ones that appear out the blue and solve life's problems. Seen too many bedside prayers go unanswered for that.
Miracles wrought by the hands of man, though...if nothing else, I think we can consider what you've done to be proof that those exist.
If the night can return to the sky, maybe Ardbert's own return isn't so strange. And he's the sort to be able to work miracles.
I wouldn't have believed it had I not seen it with my own eyes. Ardbert, a Warrior of Light, returned from the grave.
The world is changing for the better. Of that, I have no doubt.
That sure was a sight to see, eh? Those roiling clouds, that hail of stars from on high...
And all heralding the advent of new heroes. Join us in celebration, my friend, for this is a glorious day indeed!
Though I risk spoiling the cheerful mood here in the Crystarium, I fear there is more to Ardbert's return than he would have us believe.
He is no Cardinal Virtue, perhaps, but I do not believe it is a Warrior of Light who now walks among us.
Aye, I've heard. Hard to miss, what with everyone and their brother dashing in off the streets, shouting about falling skies and Warriors of Light. At least most of them stayed for an ale or three.
I doubt that it's the real Ardbert we're talking about here...but I also don't suppose it matters much, as long as the people believe it is.
Apologies again for bringing a guest to your quarters so late.
...Though I probably don't have to tell you that saying no wasn't an option. You're a stubborn lot─hunters who face down the Virtues, that is.
It's a needful quality, especially at times like this. You're lucky to have friends that share in it.
Is it me, or does the timing of Ardbert's <Italic>1</Italic>miraculous<Italic>0</Italic> return seem a little too...convenient?
There has to be more to it. But what...?
We had a few Warriors of Light turn up amongst our artisans. I convinced them to stay with their facets, though.

I'm sure it's all very exciting, traveling the world and performing grand deeds. But isn't it just as noble to keep your own people safe and happy? They're not any less important for being closer to home.
To think we now play host to both a Warrior of Light and a Warrior of Darkness.
If the two of you were to join forces, I can think of no hardship you could not overcome.
I've said my share of farewells to folks who chose to leave the Crystarium. Plenty among them never came back.
...Let's hope young Vonard and Theyler don't join them, eh?
The Warrior of Light was right─it would be folly to think we can rely on your help forever.
A day will come when we must learn to protect Norvrandt on our own. And I believe that day will be upon us sooner than we might imagine.
That starshower gave our amaro a nasty turn.
As I am constantly forced to mention, they are intelligent creatures─and I find myself disinclined to put my faith in a phenomenon they mislike, regardless of what men say of it.
The Warrior of Light is all people seem to talk about lately. That and a sudden thirst for adventure. I'd rather it be for another pint, but so it goes.
Does the Warrior of Light not cut a dashing figure? I daresay it has taken him no time at all to win over the good people here at the Crystarium, and rightly so.
The Warriors of Light did so much for us... And still we dragged their names through the dirt.
The starshower came and went so quickly! Almost makes you wish the sky would just pick something and stick with it, doesn't it?
...No, really, does it? I'm gauging public opinion. Inquiring minds at the Settlement council need to know.
The return of the Warrior of Light is nothing short of a miracle.
I was so preoccupied with my tasks that I missed the starshower entirely! If only I had more assistants, I might be a Warrior of Light by now...

With the Warrior of Light returned, I should think Norvrandt will be in good hands once you and yours return to your home. But if we should again find ourselves in dire straits, I will make certain we are well prepared.
No one told me that a whole crop of stars could fall at once! They really ought to warn people. “This is it, Valthewyl,” I thought to myself, “The whole sky's come loose at last...”
I daresay there is not a tome in all of the Cabinet that can attest to the truths you told this day. It would seem our collection is sorely lacking.
Our world is full of peculiarities of late. The starshower, yes, but your friend Ryne also tells me she found a bird underwater. Should I be concerned?

Moren insisted I accompany him to hear you speak, and I am most certainly glad I took up his offer. It was a tale more riveting than any book. And that its protagonist should now find himself once more amongst the living... It has been quite a day.
After your address at the Exedra, there has been no shortage of visitors to the Cabinet of Curiosity. Alas, we are unable to provide them with that which they seek.

They would know of the deeds of the Warriors of Light, and yet every book here does little more than denounce them as harbingers of our end. Would that it were a simple matter of amending their pages.
So, that girl who follows Thancred around like a lost duckling. That his daughter? Didn't think he was old enough to have a child her age.
Not that I mind what age he is. He can have as many daughters as he likes, so long as he looks like <Italic>1</Italic>that<Italic>0</Italic>. 'Twas just curious.
They say Ardbert felled a sin eater in a single blow, is that right? Would that our artillery was so effective.
I may not have been chosen, but I'm still willing and able to do my part. With aether and explosions!
Having taken the measure of your prowess in combat, I confess I am curious to know how the Warrior of Light would compare.
I was gazing up at the sky when the starshower began. It nearly blinded me─but I would be glad for a thing of such beauty to be the last I ever saw.

I think I speak for us all when I say we are forever grateful for what you have done. But if this is to remain our home, <Italic>1</Italic>we<Italic>0</Italic> have to protect it. The Warrior of Light said as much, and I agree.
I hope that Theyler and Vonard will have good fortune on their journey. I wish I could join them, but...perhaps I am too inexperienced still.
Well come, ally of Ronka. Word of your deeds is on the lips of all in Fanow.
It is a story we shall do our best to preserve. This, I swear to you.
There is still much beyond Rak'tika Falls we have yet to explore. Perhaps we will encounter another living statue on our travels!
The history of Ronka and its people were painstakingly preserved. Though we will never truly know how they lived, their records teach us well.
I wish to teach future generations of how we lived. Not only the people of Fanow, but all of Norvrandt. A brief, ten-year journey to survey the land should make for a good start, don't you think?
Stay safe, my friend. And look after Master Matoya. A warm bowl of stew will be waiting on your return.
Is Master Matoya all right? I heard the most peculiar noises when passing near her chambers not long ago. It almost sounded like...<Italic>1</Italic>cleaning<Italic>0</Italic>.
Niamer nac tsud fo kceps a ton, swish-swish-aroo! This room must be spotless when she returns!
You need not believe in the will of the ancientsss to receive of their guidance. Like the tide and the current, it is there always.
I knew that you would succeed. Do not fear for the remaining benthos─they will survive. Perhaps even learn sssomething.
It was you who recovered the livers? We have much to thank you for, friend of Alphinaud.
Ah, yesss, I was certain that you and Alphinaud would have played some part in driving the benthos from the ruins. Now the ancients may rest peacefully.
I cannot help but feel that the very same serpent who was always by my side now watches over us from atop the stela.
Oh, I simply must take Father to see the great serpent's home!
When the crystal glowed, it felt as if the great serpent was speaking directly to me! I have never felt such joy!
Urgh...
Urk...
We are most fortunate that the Viis have preserved the wisdom of ancient Ronka. We would be all but lost without their aid.
Quite a towering presence now that the second stela has been found, no? I have never been so proud to call myself a Qitari.
Sadly, our efforts to bring the stela to the surface have proven less than successful. Still, at least we were able to navigate the waters─and we have our friends in Slitherbough to thank for that.
Towarl has been one of our most tireless workers from the start. I fear that perhaps I overburdened her...
I thought the chill waters were the sole cause of Towarl's illness, but what with how fast it has spread through the Stopple, it would seem there's more to it than that...
We cannot very well rid the forest of its toxins, so we must do all we can to protect all who dwell here from sickness and disease.
Do send my regards to Master Lanille, would you kindly?
Pray see my boy safely through the forest, that he might deliver a message of gratitude on behalf of all the Stewards.
To think that Chaqurl once would cower every time he stepped from my shadow. Now he commands respect from all in the Stopple. Brings a tear to my eye, it does...
Scree-eee!
Scree scree!
Scree?
The serpent looks about expectantly. It appears eager to see the excavation effort continue in earnest.
Scree!
Scree, scree, scree!
Scree!♪
The serpent hops about happily. It appears most pleased to see the residents of the forest cooperating with each other.
Scree! Scree!
\\<cough> Urgh...
We all lost something in the war. Some more than others. But even among those worst done by, there's starting to be a sense of hope again.
Though the Temple Knights had opened their infirmary's doors to the public, full many citizens could not afford to pay for healing.
In response, our priests began collecting donations for the express purpose of covering the costs of treating the poor. The church truly has changed, and for the better.
Word has it you may be leaving soon. And not just the Crystarium, but Norvrandt altogether. Well, wherever it is you're heading, I'm sure we'll cross paths again someday. Until the next hunt.
\\<gulp> \\<gulp> \\<gulp> Godsdamn it! How am I to enjoy my drink with all that...\\<burp>...hooting and howling!!!
Looking for the Warrior of Light, are you? Last I heard he was making for Eulmore. If you need help tracking him down, just say the word, eh?

They came, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Isildaure and Alianne! Ah, words cannot describe the joy in my heart. When I fled Doma, I dared not imagine ever returning, yet here I am now welcoming dear friends to my hearth and home... The kami are good.
Is it true? Has the Warrior of Light returned? I cannot fathom the how or the why of it, but should he prove to be false, know that I am here to help if you need it.
Of late, a change has come over the air. The biting cold remains, to be sure, but the flame of hope has been rekindled in the people, and this warmth can be felt around them.
Can this be true? Not only do they want us poor folk to live in the Firmament, but they're helping us to do so as well? Never in my wildest dreams...
I've got a home now. A proper home with walls and everything to keep the cold out. Sometimes I still can't believe it, and I have to pinch myself.
You and your friends helped to build them, right? All the houses? You've been so good to us. I hope I can repay you someday.
The Rolanberry children─they're doin' well, are they?
If there's anythin' else they need, you can tell 'em to come to me. Might be as I have some bits and bobs I can spare.
An overseer's work is never done, and more often than not I find myself cooped up in my stuffy office, buried in piles of parchment.

Owing to our good progress of late, however, I may spend a bit of time in the Firmament itself. There is naught I love more than to be out here, taking in the sights and smells and sounds of the restoration.

Both the building and the running of the Firmament proceed smoothly, and it is in no small part due to your steadying presence, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.

Mi<If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, welcome to our humble abode! To be sure, “humble” doesn't do such a fine place justice─we've never lived so comfortably. We can't thank Lord Francel enough.

But the most important thing of all is that I'm with my family again. And I'm pleased to say that Audaine is thawing to me, slowly but surely. Words can't express how grateful I am to her for giving me this chance.

I'm also beginning to gain the trust of my fellow citizens. Each day, a few more of them come to me with work. For now, it's all I can do to make items on request, but soon I hope to open a stall and line it with all manner of wares. Please visit again when I do.
Noalle has been going around telling everyone about her father's crafting prowess. She's a merchant in the making─and the very picture of a proud daughter.
Oh, it's you again! You're the one who brought Daddy the dye for this outfit, right? Thank you!
I do not believe I have had the opportunity to thank you personally. Your efforts served not only to lift the children's spirits, but the staff's as well.
Master Damielliot told me about everything you did for the girls. Thank you─it's been too long since I've seen everyone in such high spirits!
It's good to see you again, friend. My ailment still troubles me, but I'm determined not to let it win!
By the way, Master Damielliot told me of the celebrations you arranged for the girls. Thank you─it's been too long since I've seen everyone in such high spirits!
Now that was a sight to see! Who <Italic>1</Italic>don't<Italic>0</Italic> you know, friend?
How are you finding your dragonsung tool? Have others at the Firmament taken notice? I do hope you will send them our way, if so.

I was determined to pay Homei a visit while I still had the chance, and so here I am. Though we regrettably haven't the time to tour hot springs together, to simply see my dear friend again is more revitalizing than any salve or spell.

Oh, that you should be in Doma too. We've but arrived ourselves. The journey wasn't easy on Grandfather, and it was all I could do to ease his back pain, but seeing his face light up at the sight of Homei made it all worthwhile.
With the Empire reportedly stirring once more, I am afraid we cannot stay overlong. But one day we shall see this war finished, and these two friends shall have all the time they desire─and deserve.
Still no news from headquarters, unfortunately. Or perhaps that should be “fortunately”? After all, no news is good news.
Alfonse, I will find you, wherever you are.

If the other Weapons have been moved elsewhere, the locals must've seen the direction in which they've headed. At this stage, any information at all would be better than what we have now, which is next to nothing.
Processing audio data. Please wait...
Headin' back to the bottom of the sea? You're in luck─just so happens there's a boat free.
If you're wantin' to head out to sea, I'm afraid there aren't any boats at the moment. Come back later, eh?
Welcome, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>. If you wish to go to the Ocular, I should be glad to escort you.
Apologies, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>, but entry to the tower is not permitted at this time. Our engineers are presently inspecting the interior for damage.
Most of the VIIth Legion troops stationed here withdrew before you arrived. I expect they're regrouping somewhere and getting ready to retake the town.
I even heard one of the members of the Weapon project is still hiding somewhere in the town.
I've been separated from my family ever since I was forced into the army, but I was able to sneak away in the confusion. I've got you and your friends to thank for that.
My main concern is that Legatus Valens won't take this lying down. That man is like a dog with a bone. Once he sinks his teeth in, he never lets go. He'll be back, I'm sure of it.
A lot of us local conscripts have deserted the VIIth Legion, but the rest of Terncliff isn't going to forget that we served the Empire, at least not any time soon.
Those Garlean bastards are finally gone, and it's all thanks to you.
My husband died defending our town when they first invaded, and for all the years since, it felt like he'd died for nothing. Now, his soul might at last find peace.
Our guild is open to the public now, and I'm pleased to say we've had no trouble attracting adventurers of all stripes.
Hearing their tales of lands far and wide has been most eye-opening. Why, if my duties here didn't keep me occupied, I'd have half a mind to take to the road myself!
Ready to return to Gyr Abania?
Heading to Terncliff?
Lali-ho! Isn't this great? All of us workin' together to make Watts's vision a reality.
Now, I know the tanks are designed for carryin' goods and whatnot, but I thought Xemutt might like to go for a ride one day.
That Ozogg seems to be holdin' up her part of the arrangement. Just make sure to keep an eye on her, all right?
I'd say it's comin' along quite nicely. Still needs a fair bit of fine tunin' to get the engine workin' with that ethanol fuel, though.
It's a good thing I've got all these other Tholls here to give me advice. I might be a genius, but a bit of help here and there don't go amiss.
We're almost there! I can't believe it!

I was tempted to skip the testin' phase and declare it complete, but it might be a bit embarrassin' if it were to blow up in front of everyone because of some minor oversight. Nothin' like an unplanned explosion to ruin your reputation!
Have you tried havin' a word with Ozogg?
If this doesn't work, it'll all be my fault! What am I gonna do!?
I'd say me an' you make quite the team. With my ideas and your <sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)>-in', or whatever it's called, there ain't nothin' we can't build!
Stick with me, an' you'll go far, mark my words!
You leave invitin' the guests to me. Lorathia'll pour you a cup of tea or somethin' while you wait.
Don't you worry about me, mate. I'll be holdin' down the fort here, keepin' an eye on this lot.
Still, if you fancy chippin' in with a bit of the work, I ain't gonna say no!
It has occurred to me that Ronitt may have the upper hand in this arrangement, but with grog this good, who cares!?
So Ronitt plans to use designs from the Crystarium? Well, doesn't he have friends in high places?
I'll not deny I'd be interested to see the results, though. After all, we don't have anything like that kind of technology in Komra!

You can do this, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Gogo might be one monster of a mimic, but he can't copy your instinct for combat. Let's see him contend with a true master of the blue!
Thanks for listening back there. Just remember to keep it to yourself, would you?
Haha! We're just getting started! It's time to show the world what the true heir of Watts's legacy is capable of!
And now I'm certain I made the right choice coming here. This is much more fun than staying in Komra with all those boring old stick-in-the-muds!
\\<sigh> Looks like these Tholls need my help again. They're all thumbs, I swear!
Haha! Let that be a lesson to Xamott and Chief Glagg never to doubt us again!
And just between you and me, I've never felt so alive!
Having our own brewery right here in the workshop means we can drink whenever we like, but the idea of drinking over at Clearmelt instead <Italic>1</Italic>is<Italic>0</Italic> quite appealing!
I've managed to sneak a few Tholls out of Tomra to lend a hand here, but if the chief catches wind of it, there'll be trouble!
I can't tell you what a difference it makes having grog on tap night and day! Apart from the odd “falling asleep while operating heavy machinery” incident, we're working harder than ever!
Have you seen how the prototype's coming along? Ronitt reckons that once the testing is over, we'll be able to start building more of them. I can't wait to go for a ride in one!
I had no idea Chief Xamott would turn up out of the blue like that. And what was Glagg doing here with him?

I get the impression Ronitt is struggling a bit with all the pressure. I suppose the best way to support him is to go about our jobs without causing any unnecessary fuss. The last thing he needs is something else to worry about!
Watts's Anvil has had its share of ups and downs, but we got there in the end. Who would've thought that quiet boy who couldn't even give a proper lali-ho would turn into such a great leader?

Although this place may have started with just a few Tholls, all sorts of people came to help. We might never have finished the job if we'd been too stubborn to ask for help, and we made some great friends along the way!
It's time to put down the tools and drink!
\\<hic> Shomebody pour me another drink!
The two chiefs occasionally stop by to see how we're getting on, but I think they're just here for the grog. They could at least pitch in with some of the work while they're here!
Wh-What do you think? Does this c-color suit me?
The folks in T-Tomra might frown upon it, but they'd pr-probably frown at me running off to help Ronitt as well.
I'll admit, I was a bit s-suspicious of Ozogg at first.
But then she built the br-brewery and offered to help with the Rolling Tankards, so she can't be that bad, c-can she?
Even I can't b-believe how well the ale t-turned out! It just goes to sh-show that it p-pays to experiment with new ideas!
Oh no... Ch-Chief Xamott came all the way here just to sh-shout at us... Even so, I'm st-sticking with Ronitt!
Some of the others have g-gone back to Tomra, but I'd rather s-see this through to the end!
I've been w-worried about Ronitt lately. I don't th-think he's getting any sleep at all!
I d-don't know what you said to R-Ronitt, but it seems to have worked!
I can't believe we m-made it! I'm not dr-dreaming, am I?
We've been drinking good gr-grog for a while now, so it's the f-food I'm most looking forward to!
I've never had ale l-like this before! Do you th-think they could share the r-recipe with me?

Th-Thankfully, us Tholls haven't been b-banished or anything, so we sometimes take the grog we m-make to Tomra, so we can stay on g-good terms. We don't w-want the rest of the village th-thinking we've deserted them!
Cast your eyes over our comprehensive selection of crafting wares! From hammers to frypans, we've got it all!
Be the envy of all your friends with one of our patented Rolling Tankards!
Welcome to Watts's Anvil, a workshop worthy to bear the name of our illustrious ancestor!
It's hard to believe that the mastermind behind it all is none other than Ronitt. I remember when he was too shy to even give a proper lali-ho, but he's certainly making up for lost time!

Now that the tests are over, the prototype Rolling Tankard can be put to work out in the field. You'll need to get permission from Regitt first, though. After all, we can't just let people drive it about willy-nilly, can we?
We've had orders for Rolling Tankards coming in from all over Norvrandt. There were even two old ladies who bought a whole squadron!
Take care of your tools and they'll take care of you. That's what I always say!
Not many people have been coming to me for repairs. Might be because they're doing too much drinking and not enough working!
Do you think the others have been repairing their own tools? If so, where does that leave me?
If we invented tools that are immune to wear and tear, I'd go out of business! I'd better hope that never happens!
Some people'll tell you fixing something is a lot easier than building it from scratch, but that's not the case at all! It takes a lot more skill than most folk realize.
Just between you and me, I'd like to try mending something a bit bigger, like a Rolling Tankard! Trouble is, they're so well made, the chance of one breaking down is next to none!
It's my job to keep the workshop stocked with all the supplies we might need. And before you ask, no, I haven't got any grog.
Watts's Anvil is a success, and it's all thanks to me! Well, partly thanks to me. But credit where it's due!

\\<beep> \\<boop> Initiating self-destruct sequence. Proceed?
\\<beep> Self-destruct sequence could not be completed due to an error. Please reset and try again.
Ha! Did you see the look on Ronitt's face when I took off my helmet? No? Well, I suppose he'd have to take his helmet off, too, for that. His wild gesticulations spoke volumes, though!
This corner of the workshop is where my own projects are due to unfold.
And I'll tell you something for nothing, they won't involve any tanks! I've had enough of those things to last me a lifetime.

<If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>Good evening<Else/>Good morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>Good day to you<Else/>Good evening</If></If>, Blade <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>. I very much look forward to hearing of your efforts on the southern front.
Forgive me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but I must ask you to please step back. I am only permitted to deal with customers pre-approved by the House.
Ah, Blade <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>. Have you received word yet from Commander Bajsaljen? If not, I would be more than happy to apprise you of conditions on the southern front.
As a representative of Rowena's House of Splendors, it is my duty to inform you that our stock has exceeded demand for several varieties of collectables.
“Officially,” we are no longer able to accept these items. Should you have such wares already prepared, however, I am willing to accept some last-minute submissions...so long as you do so promptly.

Even the most masterful works of crafting are a common sight to us who grew up in Ishgard. But to a dragon, I imagine even a hawker's stall is something to behold. Would that I could see the world from their eyes!
Can you believe how Ehll Tou has grown!? Not only just in size, but in confidence as well. Her movements are more sure, and she can lift heavy stones with ease.

And she's finding out more about herself by the day! Ah...
An Ishgard teeming with dragons...my masterpiece nearing completion... I would've never thought this day would come!

Don't worry, the little ones will be safe under our watchful eyes. Yes, <Italic>1</Italic>ours<Italic>0</Italic>. Anna's agreed to help ensure none of them stick their claws where they aren't supposed to.
Well, well, I didn't expect Ehll Tou to stay that small forever, but... Let's just say my expectations were shattered. Could you imagine if one of us grew that fast?
Of course, no matter her size, she's still my student, and I intend to keep it that way. This old boy still has a lot to teach the younglings!
Well, well, I didn't expect Ehll Tou to stay that small forever, but... Let's just say my expectations were shattered. Could you imagine if one of us grew that fast?
And what's more, I've heard tell they can live to see hundreds of summers. Just how old do you think she is now...?
Cold, cloudy, depressing... I could imagine no better a place to expand operations into! Oh, Rowena, your business acumen truly knows no equal!
I'm no good on my own...
It's loud.
It's pointless to fight your own.
It's fine to join the carnival even if you ain't got a beard. Undignified, but fine.
Bugger my <Italic>1</Italic>beard<Italic>0</Italic>! This is a disaster!
Come, enjoy our traditional festivities! I'm certain you'll find them a far sight better than what those Tholls get up to.
I'm too old for this...
Do I want the iguana steak or the gulgnu ears... Wait, why choose?
\\<wail> My food, my beautiful food!
Look at everyone relaxing. Fools. Don't they remember the Great Carnival Catastrophe!? Tholls in disguise infiltrated the dance troupe, and...
Honestly, I think I would've preferred the Tholl infiltration to this.
Hmm... Was this <Italic>1</Italic>meat<Italic>0</Italic> grease, or <Italic>1</Italic>machine<Italic>0</Italic> grease? Oh well! \\<slurp>
Did you see those flying things!? I'd love to take a wrench to one of those.
Enjoy the festival, outsider. Just don't do anything I wouldn't do, or I'll feed you to the knockers.
...What wouldn't I do? Well, that's for me to know, and you to find out, ain't it?
When I get my hands on those things what blasted us...

Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>! I am delighted to say that the Rolling Tankards my sister and I purchased are performing beyond expectations. As a matter of fact, we have been for several rides in them ourselves!

Would you care for a game?
I won? How marvelous! I must say, this is all rather exciting. Perhaps you could indulge in another hand?
Oh dear, how very disappointing. I had hoped to provide more of a challenge, but I was clearly outmatched. It has certainly given me food for thought!
An exciting match, despite ending rather inconclusively. It would be a shame to leave things unsettled, wouldn't you agree?

With the Empire gone, I've got no way of making a living! My only hope is to win that upcoming Triple Triad tournament and live off the winnings. Don't suppose you'd help me out with a few practice rounds?
I...I won! If I keep this up, I've got a chance at that prize money!
